last_episode_to_air.name: Divide and Conquer
last_episode_to_air.overview: Lord Dregg launches a final attack on the Ninja Turtles.

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
overview: Four turtles fall into the sewers and are befriended by Hamato Yoshi a Japanese man sent to New York who was forced to live in the sewers. One day he sees a strange green glow which transforms the four turtles into human-like creatures. Hamato (now Master Splinter) changes into a giant rat from the green glow and teaches the turtles the skills of the ninja as they team up with news reporter April O'Neil to battle against Yoshi's arch enemy Shredder and Krang, an alien warlord from Dimension X.

seasons.name: Season 9
seasons.overview: Lord Dregg rises to villainy to battles the Turtles.

episodes.name: Turtle Tracks
episodes.overview: April O'Neil, ace reporter for Channel 6, investigates recent break-ins, allegedly by Ninjas, which have resulted in the thefts of numerous technologies. A chance encounter with a gang of thieves soon leads her to a bigger story when she is saved from the criminals by four Ninja trained, mutated Turtles.

episodes.name: Enter: The Shredder
episodes.overview: The Shredder kidnaps Splinter in an attempt to lure the Turtles to his own cause. In order to rescue Splinter the Turtles must enter the Shredder's mobile fortress and brave it's dangerous weaponry.

episodes.name: A Thing about Rats
episodes.overview: Baxter Stockman, a mad scientist, is showing an exterminator his new invention: a rat catching robot called Mousers.

episodes.name: Hot Rodding Teenagers from Dimension X
episodes.overview: Shredder experiments with the Inter-Dimensional Portal, hoping to contact Krangs' Rock Soldiers and prepare an invasion of Earth, but a group of fun-loving aliens called the Neutrionos, renegades in Krang's dimension, take advantage of the Portal's opening and use it to arrive on Earth.

episodes.name: Shredder & Splintered
episodes.overview: As Shredder lures Splinter into he Technodrome, this time with the promise that a weapon in his possession can restore the sensei to human form, the Turtles confront a giant-sized Krang, now in a new body, in the heart of New York City.

episodes.name: Return of the Shredder
episodes.overview: Just when the Turtles believe themselves rid of Shredder, tin-grin is able to persuade Krang to return him to Earth.

episodes.name: The Incredible Shrinking Turtles
episodes.overview: While practicing their martial arts in Central Park, the Turtles witness an alien spaceship crash into a small pond. The pilot warns them that they must find the three fragments of the Eye of Zarnof.

episodes.name: It Came from Beneath the Sewers
episodes.overview: While the Turtles and April O'Neil scour the city for the Second Fragment of the Eye of Zarnov, Shredder sheepishly reports to Krang that he has lost the First Fragment.

episodes.name: The Mean Machines
episodes.overview: After the batteries died in the alien crystal converger, Donatello, using spare circuits from the space ship, builds a tracking device to help locate the second fragment of the Eye of Zarnov.

episodes.name: Curse of the Evil Eye
episodes.overview: The Turtles are still on the search for the last fragment. Shredder finds the last fragment and connects all three to his helmet.

episodes.name: The Case of the Killer Pizzas
episodes.overview: Krang finally relents and provides Shredder with help in defeating the Turtles.

episodes.name: Enter: The Fly
episodes.overview: Frustrated at Baxter's latest failure, Shredder contacts Krang in Dimension X and demands that Rocksteady and Bebop be sent to aid him.

episodes.name: Invasion of the Punk Frogs
episodes.overview: Shredder plans to acquire more mutagen and create more mutants. An ion storm in Dimension X interferes with the dimensional portal.

episodes.name: Splinter No More
episodes.overview: Sensing Master Splinter's despair at his new life as a rat, the Turtles agree to use the small amount of mutagen that they have left to concoct a formula that will revert Splinter back into Yoshi.

episodes.name: New York's Shiniest
episodes.overview: Shredder learns that the police have created a robotic cop and plans to steal then clone it. April gets a tip about the new experimental cop Rex-1 and breaks into the lab with her news camera for an exclusive story.

episodes.name: Teenagers from Dimension X
episodes.overview: While cruising around Dimension X, the Nutrinos decide to buzz the Technodrome. The Nutrinos learn of Krang & Shredder's latest plan to destroy the Turtles.

episodes.name: The Cat Woman of Channel Six
episodes.overview: While experimenting with a matter transporter in his secret hideout, Shredder sends Rocksteady and Bebop to a nearby garbage dump. Through a series of mishaps, Rocksteady and Bebop find themselves in the Turtles' Lair.

episodes.name: Return of the Technodrome
episodes.overview: Krang, sick of Shredder's constant failings, resolves to return the Technodrome to Earth.

episodes.name: Beneath these Streets
episodes.overview: Beneath the city streets, deep in the bowels of the sewer system, Splinter is less than pleased with the Turtles when he encounters them lounging around the TV rather than practicing their daily katas.

episodes.name: Turtles On Trial
episodes.overview: The Turtles can't understand why people would hate them. April has her make-up department make human masks so the Turtles could move more freely in the streets.

episodes.name: Attack of the 50-Foot Irma
episodes.overview: While preparing for Irma's birthday party, Michelangelo realizes he has forgotten to invite the guest of honor. He contacts April, who is in the midst of interviewing Professor Von Zifflein about the discovery of a meteorite that just crashed in the area.

episodes.name: The Maltese Hamster
episodes.overview: The Turtles, wearing their trench coats and fedoras, investigate a wave of mob terror.

episodes.name: Sky Turtles
episodes.overview: The Turtles go flying when the Shredder invents a gravity-altering device.

episodes.name: The Old Switcheroo
episodes.overview: The nightwatchman at Cybertech Laboratories spotted some weird character hanging around. Mr. Thompson is convinced that he must be a friend of the Turtles.

episodes.name: Burne's Blues
episodes.overview: In the middle of a summer heat wave the Turtles cool down by having pizza at Plink's.

episodes.name: The Fifth Turtle
episodes.overview: Dressed in their human disguises, Donatello and Raphael venture out of their lair to buy supplies to make pizza.

episodes.name: Enter: The Rat King
episodes.overview: Thompson assigns April to research the growing rat infestation. She is pursued by an army of rats and escapes on a passing city bus.

episodes.name: Turtles at the Earth's Core
episodes.overview: Dinosaurs invade the Big Apple. Befriending a young diplodocus the Turtles trace the invading dinosaurs to their source finding a lost world.

episodes.name: April Fool
episodes.overview: Emperor Aleister of Malicuria comes to New York City, bringing along a shard of Lydium 90 to the USA.

episodes.name: Attack of the Big MACC
episodes.overview: The Turtles are watching April's special report, live from the Army testing laboratory, on the first public display of a new super laser when a bolt of lightning from an electrical storm overloads the Super Laser's computer.

episodes.name: The Ninja Sword of Nowhere
episodes.overview: Krang's computers detect an alien metal on the surface of the Earth. Krang sends Shredder, along with an Alien Metal Detector, to the surface to find it.

episodes.name: 20.000 Leaks Under the City
episodes.overview: Still searching for a way to destroy the Turtles, Krang develops a super pump that he intends to use to flood the sewers.

episodes.name: Take Me to Your Leader
episodes.overview: After awaking from a nightmare in which he failed himself and his comrades in a battle against Shredder, Leonardo feels that he is unfit as a leader and, donning civilian clothes, decides to leave the lair.

episodes.name: Four Musketurtles
episodes.overview: At the local Mardi Gras parade April suggests that the Turtles should dress in costume.

episodes.name: Turtles, Turtles Everywhere
episodes.overview: April covers the launch of a new system developed by the city to help clean up the city's garbage problems faster than ever.

episodes.name: Cowabunga Shredhead
episodes.overview: The Turtles use hypnosis to persuade Michelangelo to stop craving pizza.

episodes.name: Invasion of the Turtle Snatchers
episodes.overview: The Turtles throw April a surprise party to celebrate her first anniversary as a reporter at Channel Six News, but April is not feeling very celebratory. Burne Thompson has suggested that she will not be celebrating her second anniversary if she does not find a story soon.

episodes.name: Camera Bugged
episodes.overview: A Polarisoid arrives on Earth taking photos of everything and everything he takes a photo of disappears.

episodes.name: Green with Jealousy
episodes.overview: Krang sets his sights on a powerful Nuclear-Powered Submarine, believing it's fuel will be more than enough to power the technodrome.

episodes.name: Return of the Fly
episodes.overview: Noticing that the Technodrome's ballast tanks are low, Krang decides to take the Technodrome closer to the surface so that it can siphon off water from an underground reservoir. Meanwhile, Donatello has built a device that will track the Technodrome's movements.

episodes.name: Casey Jones: Outlaw Hero
episodes.overview: A self-appointed vigilante, wearing a hockey mask and named Casey Jones, is striking fear in the hearts of the city's criminals.

episodes.name: Mutagen Monster
episodes.overview: In an attempt to hijack two separate trains carrying the ingredients needed to make mutagen, Rocksteady and Bebop cause their head-on collision, resulting in the spillage of both chemicals in the city's train yard.

episodes.name: Corporate Raiders from Dimension X
episodes.overview: High ranking corporate executives are kidnapped by men in business suits. The Turtles don't get involved until they learn that one of these corporations is the world's largest suppliers of pizza.

episodes.name: Pizza by the Shred
episodes.overview: Michaelangelo gets a job as a pizza delivery boy. But who's his new boss?

episodes.name: Super Bebop & Mighty Rocksteady
episodes.overview: Shredder orders Rocksteady and Bebop to place the mesmerizer atop the Channel Six News Building Tower.

episodes.name: Beware the Lotus
episodes.overview: Krang hires a female Ninja, Lotus, to replace Shredder. Lotus has agreed to help Krang locate the Turtles in exchange for 100 pounds of gold.

episodes.name: Blast from the Past
episodes.overview: Krang and Shredder have been defeated once too often by the Turtles. Shredder takes Rocksteady and Bebop up to the Earth's surface and to the Asian-American Cultural Center where the burial urn of an ancient noble warrior and founder of the Foot Clan, Shibana-Sama, is on display.

episodes.name: Leatherhead: Terror of the Swamp
episodes.overview: While Raphael is reliving the past, via the Turtles' photo album, their frog friends in the Florida Swamps are being terrorized by a mutant alligator known as Leatherhead.

episodes.name: Michaelangelo's Birthday
episodes.overview: Today is Michaelangelo's birthday and the other turtles plan a surprise party.

episodes.name: Usagi Yojimbo
episodes.overview: Thanks to a run-in with General Traag from Dimension X, the Turtles discover that Krang is experimenting with his dimensional portal again.

episodes.name: Case of the Hot Kimono
episodes.overview: April's Aunt Agatha, a detective, visits her at Channel Six News and asks to meet the Turtles. Meanwhile, Michelangelo and Leonardo encounter two crooks, Bruce and Rodney, who are stealing kimonos from all over town.

episodes.name: Usagi Come Home
episodes.overview: In an effort to rid himself of the Turtles, Shredder with the help of Rocksteady and Bebop kidnap Obento, caretaker of the Far East Animal Society then blackmail Usagi Yojimbo into destroying the Turtles.

episodes.name: The Making of Metalhead
episodes.overview: While the Turtles are suffering from turtle pox, a disease that affects only mutant Turtles, Krang has developed a robotic turtle that he calls Metalhead.

episodes.name: Leatherhead Meets the Rat King
episodes.overview: Leatherhead has come to the city searching for the Turtles. While crawling through the sewers he encounters the Rat King who charges him with trespassing.

episodes.name: The Turtle Terminator
episodes.overview: Rocksteady and Bebop, on Shredder's orders, kidnap Irma. As soon as April discovers Irma has been abducted, she contacts the Turtles.

episodes.name: The Great Boldini
episodes.overview: The Turtles, Zach and his friend Caitlin visit the Museum where a magician, the Great Boldini, intends to make a valuable emerald disappear.

episodes.name: The Missing Map
episodes.overview: Zach and his brother Walt visit the Turtles. As they leave, Walt takes a map that could guide Shredder to the lair if it happens to fall into the wrong hands.

episodes.name: The Gang's All Here
episodes.overview: Shredder tries to trick the Turtles into eating cookies made with anti-mutagen. Michelangelo, wanting to be a human, tries one of the cookies and it mutates him into a teenager.

episodes.name: The Grybyx
episodes.overview: An affectionate, cuddly creature from another world shows up on Earth, with the ability to move objects by mental power. It turns out to be an escaped pet of the Neutrinos.

episodes.name: Mister Ogg Goes to Town
episodes.overview: While searching for a device to transform crude oil into liquid hydrogen, Krang accidentally brings Mr. Ogg from Dimension Z to earth.

episodes.name: Shredderville
episodes.overview: The Turtles are frustrated that they let Shredder slip away from them again. They feel like giving up, and wish they had never been born.

episodes.name: Bye Bye Fly
episodes.overview: A team of archaeologists stumble upon a temple of unknown origin buried near the Turtles' lair. Before they can investigate further, they are frightened off by Baxter Fly, who explores the temple himself.

episodes.name: The Big Rip Off
episodes.overview: In a last ditch attempt to gain power for the Technodrome, Krang Sends Rocksteady and Bebop to steal a newly created set of energy modules from a hi-tech science lab located at Fort Charles.

episodes.name: The Big Break In
episodes.overview: Now successfully re-energized, The Technodrome begins moving towards the surface. Krang sends for a miniaturizer from Dimension X. With it he can shrink anyone and anything that stands in his path.

episodes.name: The Big Blow Out
episodes.overview: The Technodrome suddenly surfaces. The Turtles barely get out of its way in time before Shredder begins firing lasers

episodes.name: Plan Six From Outer Space
episodes.overview: With the Technodrome in serious need for new equipment, Bebop and Rocksteady are sent to Earth, disguised in human form, to capture the Channel 6 building and return it to Dimension X.

episodes.name: Turtles of the Jungle
episodes.overview: A professor's new ray-gun causes plants to go wild and his pet ape Jocko to become a giant rampaging monkey. By using the same ray-gun, Donatello is increased to Jocko's size so he can fight the giant ape and save April from him.

episodes.name: Michaelangelo Toys Around
episodes.overview: While trying to see the new toys at the Toy Fair, Michaelangelo stumbles upon a plot to take over a noted toy company.

episodes.name: Peking Turtle
episodes.overview: The Turtles must battle a reanimated Terracotta Army after Shredder steals an energy device shaped like a giant pearl, which is held and guarded by a Jade Dragon.

episodes.name: Shredder's Mom
episodes.overview: New York is in the middle of an induced heat wave caused by Shredder, who must battle the Turtles and deal with his mother, Miyoko Saki, at the same time.

episodes.name: Four Turtles and a Baby
episodes.overview: When General Tragg and his troops attack the Neutrino capital, the Neutrino leaders, Zenter and Gizzla, send their infant daughter Tribble through a portal to Earth, asking the Turtles to look after her, but Tribble causes big trouble for our heroes.

episodes.name: Turtlemaniac
episodes.overview: An eccentric billionaire, Monroe Q. Flem, who is also a collector, wishes to collect every piece of TMNT memorabilia that he can get his evil hands on, including April and the Turtles themselves.

episodes.name: Rondo in New York
episodes.overview: Shredder, Bebop, and Rocksteady are in town to steal a rare new mutagen created by Oswald Dren, a grad student. Some mutagen is accidentally spilled onto a reel of movie film causing monsters to come to life.

episodes.name: Planet of the Turtles
episodes.overview: The Turtles must save the Earth from a massive energy drain and its Apocalyptic result by traveling to another dimension where turtles are the dominant species.

episodes.name: Name That Toon
episodes.overview: A Technodrome computer disguised as an electronic keyboard ends up on Earth, and in the most unlikely of hands.

episodes.name: Menace, Maestro Please
episodes.overview: The Turtles must contend with the "Phantom of the Floxy" while trying to hinder Shredder's latest plan to bring the Technodrome back to earth.

episodes.name: Superhero for a Day
episodes.overview: Gadget Man comes out of retirement after 50 years, but is tricked by Shredder into fighting against the Turtles.

episodes.name: Back to the Egg
episodes.overview: Krang hires a multi-dimentional ring-master who intends on making the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles part of his circus by using an anti-aging serum.

episodes.name: Son of Return of the Fly II
episodes.overview: Vengeful Baxter Stockman and an A.I. computer return to Earth from a dimentional limbo and capture the Turtles while luring Shredder into their trap as well.

episodes.name: Raphael Knocks 'em Dead
episodes.overview: Raphael must contend with a mobster named Pinky McFingers when he is kidnapped from a local comedy club.

episodes.name: Bebop and Rocksteady Conquer the Universe
episodes.overview: On their latest trip to Earth, Bebop and Rocksteady steal a machine that makes everyone scared of everything.

episodes.name: Raphael Meets His Match
episodes.overview: Raphael wins a ticket to a costume party on MacDonald Crump's yacht and decides to go disguised as a Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle.

episodes.name: Slash the Evil Turtle from Dimension X
episodes.overview: Bebop and Rocksteady use Krang's new Mutagen on Bebop's pet turtle Slash so he can do their housework for them. Slash runs away and is conned by an irritated entrepreneur into framing the TMNT.

episodes.name: Leonardo Lightens Up
episodes.overview: A ray-gun makes Leonardo carefree and ignore his responsibilities. This leaves the Turtles defenseless and the city at the mercy of Maestro G Clef, a villain who destroys the city with music.

episodes.name: Were-Rats from Channel 6
episodes.overview: After many failed attempts from his rodent subjects to find food, the Rat King learns of an abandoned canister of mutagen lost in the sewers and claims it for himself.

episodes.name: Funny, They Shrunk Michaelangelo
episodes.overview: While Michelangelo is testing out a sailboard in the sewers he accidentally gets swept out into the city harbor.

episodes.name: The Big Zipp Attack
episodes.overview: Krang sends Shredder, Bebop and Rocksteady to find Rigidium to repair the Technodrome. A meteorite lands containing a large egg. The egg hatches, revealing a Zipp, a cute little creature that begins to eat the Technodrome.

episodes.name: Donatello Makes Time
episodes.overview: Professor Lloyd Cycloyd, a crazy scientist who escaped from an institution, accidentally discovers the Turtles' lair. He sees Donatello testing out one of his new inventions, a time stopper.

episodes.name: Farewell, Lotus Blossum
episodes.overview: While on their way to a movie, the Turtles rescue the Urn of Chakahachi from two thieves. The thieves pry off a pearl from the Urn before the Turtles get their hands on it.

episodes.name: Rebel Without a Fin
episodes.overview: Dr. Polidorius creates a half-man half-fish named Ray. The Doctor has Ray plant explosives in certain parts of the sewer so that he can sink the city beneath the ocean.

episodes.name: Rhino-Man
episodes.overview: J. Gordon Hungerdunger, a Texas millionaire, is holding a best super-hero contest. The winner of the contest will receive the humongous Malaprop Diamond.

episodes.name: Michaelangelo Meets Bugman
episodes.overview: Michaelangelo avidly reads a comic book which features his favorite superhero, Bugman. While reading one of the comic books, Mikey hears a cry for help in the sewer.

episodes.name: Poor Little Rich Turtle
episodes.overview: Krang has come up with yet another brilliant plan to free the Technodrome. The evil alien sends Bebop and Rocksteady to kidnap Buffy Shellhammer, 15 year-old CEO of Shellhammer Chemicals.

episodes.name: What's Michaelangelo Good For?
episodes.overview: The Turtles go along with Michaelangelo and his pet pigeon to the zoo so that Dr. Goodfellow can check the bird out.

episodes.name: The Dimension X Story
episodes.overview: Disguised as humans, Rocksteady and Bebop are sent to attach special trans-dimensional thrusters to the Channel Six Building.

episodes.name: Donatello's Degree
episodes.overview: Donatello gets an invitation to accept his degree personally from Professor Sopho at Sopho University. The only problem is that the invitation is addressed to a Miss Donna Tello.

episodes.name: The Big Cufflink Caper
episodes.overview: The Turtles, bored at the lack of action, decide to investigate when they hear that cufflinks are being stolen around the city.

episodes.name: Leonardo VS Tempestra
episodes.overview: The Turtles sneak into an arcade in the middle of the night to play video games. Leonardo gets hooked on a game called Tempestra's Revenge.

episodes.name: Splinter Vanishes
episodes.overview: Returning from another mission, the  Turtles are shocked to discover their mentor has left the lair, leaving behind only a video taped message.

episodes.name: Raphael Drives 'Em Wild
episodes.overview: On his way home from getting pizza Raphael and a cab driver accidentally get exposed to rays from a Personality Transmogrifier.

episodes.name: Beyond the Donatello Nebula
episodes.overview: Donatello has created a device to communicate with distant galaxies. While trying to communicate with the Turtle Nebula Donatello accidentally brings a spaceship to Earth.

episodes.name: Big Bug Blunder
episodes.overview: A fly lands in the mutagen and it increases in size. Not being able to control it, Bebop and Rocksteady send the giant insect to Earth.

episodes.name: The Foot Soldiers Are Revolting
episodes.overview: After Bebop and Rocksteady blow another assignment, Shredder fires them and decides to replace them with an intelligent Foot Soldier named Alpha One.

episodes.name: Unidentified Flying Leonardo
episodes.overview: UFO sightings at an upstate farm town known as High Falls, cause April to investigate., Splinter foresees danger clouding April's visit and sends Leonardo to chaperone.

episodes.name: The Turtles and the Hare
episodes.overview: In Krang's latest scheme, Rocksteady and Bebop, dressed as Easter bunnies, are blasting people with a Docilizer Ray and turning them into timid, rabbit-like people.

episodes.name: Once Upon a Time Machine
episodes.overview: Hokum Hare discovers that Shredder has a time train to travel to the future, where he can become crimelord of a crime-free era.

episodes.name: My Brother, the Bad Guy
episodes.overview: Shredder breaks into the Ninja Hall of Fame and steals the diary of the famous Brothers Kojima. He leaves his fingerprints all over the place though, and one Lieutenant Saki, Shredder's brother, finds them.

episodes.name: Michaelangelo Meets Mondo Gecko
episodes.overview: Michaelangelo awakes in the middle of the night from a bad dream. Unable to remember what it was about, Splinter assists him through hypnotism. Mikey vividly recalls the day that he and his brothers fell into the sewer and landed in the green ooze but he also sees a small lizard crawling through the contaminant.

episodes.name: Enter: Mutagen Man
episodes.overview: In the frozen tundra of the Arctic Polar Cap, Krang rants and raves that Rocksteady and Bebop will not return in time with the Bindex 3 to load the mutagen into the rocket ship's fuel tanks before lift off. Krang' plans turn all the City's inhabitants into horribly disfigured mutants from the vapor trails of the fuel used to lift the rocket.

episodes.name: Donatello's Badd Time
episodes.overview: While road testing the Turtle Van with his latest inventions, Donatello encounters a family of criminal hillbillies known as the Badd Family.

episodes.name: Michaelangelo Meets Bugman Again
episodes.overview: Michaelangelo and the other Turtles go topside in an effort to find the latest issue of "The Adventures of Bugman", only to learn that the comic book has been canceled.

episodes.name: Muckman Messes Up
episodes.overview: Attempting to de-mutate the Turtles, Krang sends Shredder, Rocksteady and Bebop to the Earth's surface to retrieve Compound X-7.

episodes.name: Napoleon Bonafrog: Colossus of the Swamps
episodes.overview: While Krang hires some local hoods to drill for anti-freeze Shredder, Rocksteady and Bebop visit the Louisiana Swamps in search of the Mutagen Pool.

episodes.name: Raphael VS The Volcano
episodes.overview: Thanks to a malfunction in Donatello's Healthometer, an invention designed to diagnose one's health, Raphael is convinced that he is not long for this world. Raphael decides to make the world a better place with what little time he has left.

episodes.name: Landlord of the Flies
episodes.overview: Baxter Fly is back, and this time he has assembled an army of flies to infest the city, endangering millions just so Stockman can get to Shredder.

episodes.name: Donatello's Duplicate
episodes.overview: Donatello decides to create a clone of himself so that he can spend more time on his inventions while his clone spends more time fixing things around the Lair. Donny tests his latest invention on a sewer rat and accidentally gets his hand in the way, causing the rat clone to talk just like Donatello.

episodes.name: The Ice Creature Cometh
episodes.overview: While the Turtles do battle with a refrigerator that has not been defrosted lately, Rocksteady and Bebop decide that they want to be the top mutants at the Technodrome and throw out a vat of mutagen onto the frozen tundra, creating a giant Ice Creature.

episodes.name: Leonardo Cuts Loose
episodes.overview: A series of baffling crimes are being committed by "brawny burglars" with thick Austrian accents and the Turtles are on the case, but so is Casey Jones and that could mean nothing but trouble for the Turtles.

episodes.name: Pirate Radio
episodes.overview: Krang's attempt to split the Inter-Dimensional portal goes awry. By utilizing the pirate radio station WOOF Krang believes that he can use the station to lure the City's populace into Krang's Chasm.

episodes.name: Raphael, Turtle of a Thousand Faces
episodes.overview: Raphael's ego is bruised when the other Turtles laugh at him for taking a correspondence class in the art of disguise. Raphael challenges his brothers to go to Central Park and pick him out of a crowd.

episodes.name: Leonardo, the Renaissance Turtle
episodes.overview: The City Mayor announces an end to crime when he introduces Professor Mindbender and the professor's latest invention: LEX, a robotic police officer. LEX rids the streets of crime enough to allow the Turtles to take a vacation.

episodes.name: Zach and the Alien Invaders
episodes.overview: Zach, the Turtles' young friend, and honorary fifth Turtle, is infatuated with comic books, especially 'The Alien Invaders.' Zach retires his Turtle costume when his parents enroll him in the Ten-Hut Military Academy where they hope he will learn some discipline and live in the real world.

episodes.name: Welcome Back, Polarisoids
episodes.overview: Krang wants to get a hold of the Polarisoids' camera. Krang sends a fake invitation to the Polarisoids to visit Earth, only the Polarisoids think that the invitation is from the Turtles.

episodes.name: Michaelangelo, the Sacred Turtle
episodes.overview: While the other Turtles go off to the local Planetarium to see O'Malley's comet, Michaelangelo visits the Natural History Museum with April O'Neil for the unveiling of the mummy of Ahmed Turt-el.

episodes.name: Planet of the Turtleloids, Part 1
episodes.overview: The turtles, Groundchuck and Dirtbag are taken to Shellri-La by an alien "Turtleoid" named Kerma. Kerma seeks help from the turtles to defend his planet from a two-headed dragon named Herman the Horrible.

episodes.name: Planet of the Turtleloids, Part 2
episodes.overview: The turtles unmask the dragon as they prove that the menacing creature is actually operated by two renegade Turtleoid delegates. Kerma return the turtles back to Earth, where they destroy Shredder's new Technodrome Mark II and afterwards defeat Chrome Dome.

episodes.name: Rock Around the Block
episodes.overview: Krang summons General Tragg from the Dimension X to keep the Turtles busy while Shredder places a remote control transmitter upon a rocket ship preparing to launch a satellite with a new super laser.

episodes.name: Krangenstein Lives!
episodes.overview: Under the Arctic Ocean Krang is tuning up his Robotic Body. While no one is looking, Bebop and Rocksteady inadvertently destroy an important computer chip and surreptitiously replace it with one from a video game.

episodes.name: Super Irma
episodes.overview: While the Turtles are busy trying to decide what costumes to wear to this year's Channel Six Halloween party, April and Irma are doing a story on the reverse polarity magnet at Magno-Dyne Labs.

episodes.name: Adventures in Turtle-Sitting
episodes.overview: While Splinter is away on meditative satori, Donatello sets his sights on solving world hunger. He invents the food revivafiver, a device designed to reverse the aging process of food.

episodes.name: Sword of Yurikawa
episodes.overview: Krang plans to blow up the Tri-State Bridge just as a convoy of trucks carrying a rare form of toxic waste passes overhead.

episodes.name: Return of the Turtleoids
episodes.overview: The Turtles go to the Top Notch Scientific Corporation to stand guard over the sonic disintegrator.

episodes.name: Shreeka's Revenge
episodes.overview: Shreeka, an alien with an attitude and a vendetta against Krang, after having spent eons tracking him down, has finally found him.

episodes.name: Too Hot to Handle
episodes.overview: Donatello tells the other three Turtles that, based on his calculations, the Earth has changed its orbit and is heading for the Sun.

episodes.name: Nightmare in the Lair
episodes.overview: Down in the sewers, while Michelangelo, Leonardo, and Raphael are watching yet another cheesy sci-fi film, Donatello is busy building the dream-o-vision.

episodes.name: Phantom of the Sewers
episodes.overview: After another night's performance of the robotic Willie Wombat Revue at the Willie Wombat Revue Theatre, a mysterious figure, wearing a long black cape, black fedora, white face mask, and known only as the Phantom, makes an appearance.

episodes.name: Donatello Trashes Slash
episodes.overview: Donatello goes to Channel Six News to give Vernon a piece of his mind after he had made disparaging comments about Turtles on live TV.

episodes.name: Leonardo Is Missing
episodes.overview: When Donatello, Michelangelo, and Raphael return from the video arcade they discover that Donatello's lab is in disarray and Leonardo is missing.

episodes.name: Snakes Alive!
episodes.overview: While practicing their martial arts, Leonardo tells Splinter that he is convinced that there is one combat maneuver he has yet to teach the Turtles.

episodes.name: Polly Wanna Pizza
episodes.overview: Michelangelo returns from his sojourn to the pet shop with a monkey named Clyde. After only a few minutes with the undisciplined pet Leonardo, Donatello and Raphael demand that it be returned to the pet shop.

episodes.name: Mr. Nice Guy
episodes.overview: Burne assigns April a story reporting on the increase in urban crime. The only problem is that urban crime is decreasing.

episodes.name: Sleuth on the Loose
episodes.overview: While the Turtles are watching their favorite TV show April interrupts the broadcast with a special bulletin about a break-in at Dynamic Science Labs.

episodes.name: Tower of Power
episodes.overview: The Turtles and Splinter win a trip to Europe, but wind up riding in a crate with the Turtle Van. Meanwhile, Krang devises a giant electromagnet to pull the Technodrome free from an asteroid.

episodes.name: Rust Never Sleeps
episodes.overview: Krang works on an oxidizer rocket with enough power to blast the Technodrome to Earth, but something goes wrong, and instead of thrust, the device grows rust.

episodes.name: A Real Snow Job
episodes.overview: The Turtles are vacationing in the Alps, as Splinter goes off to a nearby mountain to meditate. April is in an Alpine village with Irma when she notices the ice and snow melting, unusual for this time of year.

episodes.name: Venice on a Half Shell
episodes.overview: Krang decides to use a hydrofluxer device to flood Venice, holding it for ransom.

episodes.name: Artless
episodes.overview: Two snobbish art-collecting aliens arrive in Florence and begin stealing great works of art.

episodes.name: Ring of Fire
episodes.overview: Krang sends Shredder to set up a special lens that will focus the sun's rays to create a devastating heat ray.

episodes.name: The Irish Jig Is Up
episodes.overview: Krang and Shredder decide to use Ireland as their base for the Technodrome. With a device called the Rainbow Trans-Charmer, the villains intend to turn harmless little creatures like sheep and rabbits into slavering beasts.

episodes.name: Shredder's New Sword
episodes.overview: In Dimension X Krang is using a long-range scanner and discovers a rare metal buried in a ruined castle in England. The metal turns out to be King Arthur's legendary sword, Excalibur.

episodes.name: The Lost Queen of Atlantis
episodes.overview: Shredder, Rocksteady and Bebop are searching for a valuable energy source in Athens and discover that it is April's new necklace.

episodes.name: Turtles on the Orient Express
episodes.overview: April is covering the revival of the Orient Express. Shredder is on the train with Rocksteady and Bebop carrying the supercharger, a device to accelerate the train to super speed.

episodes.name: April Gets in Dutch
episodes.overview: April is covering the showing of the world-famed Duchess Diamond. Krang wants the diamond, a flawless stone, to focus the rays on his laser dimension blade.

episodes.name: Northern Lights Out
episodes.overview: Eric Red, seizes both April and Professor Swenson's map to the underground volcanoes in Scandinavia to tap into the molten energy and melt the polar ice caps.

episodes.name: Elementary, My Dear Turtle
episodes.overview: The Turtles are in England, when they are taken back to the past, via an experimental atomic clock and must team up with Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson in order to get the clock back and return to the present.

episodes.name: Night of the Dark Turtle
episodes.overview: Donatello's Early Detection system sounds its alarm. According to Donatello's readings, the city has experienced a major vibration emanating from the Earth.

episodes.name: The Starchild
episodes.overview: While rummaging through the local junkyard the Turtles witness the crash landing of an alien spacecraft.

episodes.name: The Legend of Koji
episodes.overview: At the Museum of Fine Art Shredder uses his time portal to journey back to ancient Japan so that he can destroy Splinter and the turtles.

episodes.name: Convicts from Dimension X
episodes.overview: Thanks to a malfunction in Donatello's Inter-Dimensional Early Warning Detection Machine, a tear has occurred in the fabric of space and time, allowing two heinous criminals from Dimension X, Skaarg and Dementor, to arrive in the city.

episodes.name: White Belt, Black Heart
episodes.overview: Splinter is contacted telepathically by his sensei, Master Mogo-san who requests that Splinter meet him at Pier 17.

episodes.name: Night of the Rogues
episodes.overview: Krang, Shredder, Bebop and Rocksteady break in to the City Hall Records Department and steal maps of the sewer system dated 1895.

episodes.name: Attack of the Neutrinos
episodes.overview: While investigating the most recent robbery perpetrated by the Mole Squad, April and the Turtles stumble upon a secret meeting between the Mole Squad and Dr. Floyd O'Toole, a scientist who has been missing for weeks.

episodes.name: Escape from the Planet of the Turtleloids
episodes.overview: The Turtles visit April at Channel Six News and ask her if they could use the stations' equipment to contact their old Turtleoid buddy, Kerma, on Shell-Ri-La.

episodes.name: Revenge of the Fly
episodes.overview: Thanks to Vernon's irresponsible journalism, the Turtles find it necessary to stand guard at the Genetic Research Lab.

episodes.name: Atlantis Awakes
episodes.overview: While surfing in the white water rapids of the sewer, Michaelangelo is rescued by Merdude. Tthe Turtles, using Donatello's Porta-Tracker, volunteer to help Merdude find his way back home.

episodes.name: Dirk Savage: Mutant Hunter
episodes.overview: After an unsuccessful attempt at capturing Razar and Toka, the Turtles return to the lair to see the eccentric billionaire, A. J. Howard, spouting his ideology and his hatred for mutants across the airwaves.

episodes.name: Invasion of the Krangezoids
episodes.overview: Krang makes copies of himself and sets them loose to attack the turtles.

episodes.name: Combat Land
episodes.overview: There is a new amusement park in town and called Combat Land. The park's owner, Horatio Stressbar, has been unable to find anyone with the combat skills to give his robotic warriors a thorough work out.

episodes.name: Shredder Triumphant
episodes.overview: Shredder, Rocksteady, and Bebop arrive at the Asian arts exhibit and proceed to loot. The turtles head out to stop them despite a grave warning from splinter that there will be dire consequences.

episodes.name: Get Shredder!
episodes.overview: Shredder & Krang are still loose on Earth, but without the resources of the Technodrome, they plan to steal equipment from the abandoned Hall of Science at the World Fair. Krang's former weapons engineer, Drakus, using the guise of Beserko, also shows up to cause trouble.

episodes.name: Wrath of the Rat King
episodes.overview: Burne has created a hot line for callers to use should they spot those responsible for the destruction of the Channel Six News Building. Inside the Hall of Science, Shredder is fearful that the Turtles will eventually find a way into the building and decides to seek out an old friend in the sewers: the Rat King!

episodes.name: State of Shock
episodes.overview: After defeating a mysterious group of ninjas at the Emeryville Power Station, the Turtles decode part of a map that they were able to liberate from the would-be thieves.

episodes.name: Cry H.A.V.O.C.!
episodes.overview: The Turtles get the drop on masked thieves hijacking a jewellery store, only to have themselves arrested for the crime! Before the turtles can be booked, they are rescued by the mutants Amok and Overdrive.

episodes.name: H.A.V.O.C. in the Streets
episodes.overview: Titanus sends of couple of his H.A.V.O.C. mutants to bust into the aerospace plant and steal some much needed equipment. Only problem is that the Turtles were waiting for them.

episodes.name: Enter: Krakus
episodes.overview: Krakus, a cop from the future, arrives and thinking that the Turtles are in league with Titanus, shakes them down for information.

episodes.name: Cyber-Turtles
episodes.overview: While investigating the theft of a rare telescope, the Astro-Viewer, the Turtles discover odd tracks leading away from the National Space Exploration Center.

episodes.name: Turtle Trek
episodes.overview: Krang activates his new dimensional portal, thanks to Shredder's installation of the Energy Transmitter at the Power Relay Station, giving him access to Dimension X.

episodes.name: The Unknown Ninja
episodes.overview: While watching video tapes of old battles, Raphael sees a mystery person spying on them. While the Turtles investigate, an alien warlord named Dregg sends his TechnoGansters to steal all the gold on Earth.

episodes.name: Dregg of the Earth
episodes.overview: April contacts the Turtles to let them know that Dregg has landed on Earth and is preparing a press conference. The Turtles rush to meet April at the Park, where they hear Dregg announce his friendly intentions and offers the world his molecular converter.

episodes.name: The Wrath of Medusa
episodes.overview: Believing that the Turtles are the only thing that stands between him and total domination of the planet Dregg makes contact with Medusa, a sinisterly beautiful alien.

episodes.name: The New Mutation
episodes.overview: After challenging Dregg to a final showdown, the Turtles find themselves on the losing end. Only this time, their new mutations have been captured on film and the world believes the Super Turtles to be evil monsters.

episodes.name: The Showdown
episodes.overview: April contacts the Turtles to inform them that all the TV stations in the City are jammed. Sleazebug tries to recruit the Turtles for a martial arts tournament.

episodes.name: Split-Second
episodes.overview: Carter, April and the Turtles investigate a break-in at the Antique Timepiece Museum. Convinced that Dregg is responsible, the Turtles discover a clue on a wall display.

episodes.name: Carter the Enforcer
episodes.overview: Splinter convinces the Turtles that it is their duty to fight evil, even when the whole world is against them. Carter and the Turtles team up with April to get the goods on Dregg.

episodes.name: Doomquest
episodes.overview: Dregg broadcasts his message to the citizens of Earth about the evil mutant Turtles. The Turtles mutate in broad daylight, attack a squad of Techno Gangsters, scaring the local citizenry.

9.name: Season 9
9.overview: Lord Dregg rises to villainy to battles the Turtles.

episodes.name: The Return of Dregg
episodes.overview: While the Turtles work on using fragments of the Vortex Crystal to stabilize their mutations, Lord Dregg plans to use the fragments to create another Vortex Crystal to power his Vortex Transporter.

episodes.name: The Beginning of the End
episodes.overview: While Raphael, Michaelangelo, Donatello and Carter work on restoring Leonardo to his regular self, Mung steals all the plutonium from a power plant in order for Dregg to build a Plutonium Ray to turn Leonardo into a radioactive killer.

episodes.name: The Power of Three
episodes.overview: Mungg informs Dregg that he came across two individuals who claimed they were old acquaintances of the turtles: Shredder and Krang!

episodes.name: A Turtle in Time
episodes.overview: The Turtles', Shredder's and Krang's battles skills, powers, and memories are absorbed into Dregg.

episodes.name: Turtles to the Second Power
episodes.overview: Dregg and his crew plan an invasion Earth to make it his new home base, but first he has to get his transporter chip back from Shredder.

episodes.name: Mobster from Dimension X
episodes.overview: Dr. Alvin Huxley has demonstrated his breakthrough invention: a computer that thinks as fast as a human mind. The Globfather is on Earth and wants to get the protein computer for someone who is willing to pay a lot for it.

episodes.name: The Day the Earth Disappeared
episodes.overview: With the city breaking apart, the Turtles head to the street to investigate and see the Dreggnaut appear in the sky. With Mung's help, Dregg reprograms the transporter to open a warp in space.

episodes.name: Divide and Conquer
episodes.overview: Lord Dregg launches a final attack on the Ninja Turtles.
